initiatives.name: Boleto Payment for Utility Bills In Brazil
initiatives.pillar:
1. New local payment type offering supported: Expand coverage to include utility and government boletos (boletos de recolhimento).
2. Unified experience: Pay all boletos — vendor invoices and utility bills — from the same Jeeves flow.
3. Better visibility: All boleto payments consolidated in one place for tracking and reconciliation.
4. Operational simplicity: No need to manage separate processes or vendors for recolhimento payments.

initiatives.name: Bill Pay reconciliation for NetSuite and non-ERP
initiatives.pillar: This will allow customers to differentiate their bill payments from their card expenses during reconciliation, and sync these transactions correctly into their ERP.

initiatives.name: USD/MXN - M1 migration
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to migrate companies from Jeeves 1.0 to Jeeves 3.0.

initiatives.name: Cards Production Health (M1)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to analyse and fix bugs in production.

initiatives.name: Cards API: Onboarding (M1)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to onboard new customers to Jeeves Cards API.

initiatives.name: Stablecoin: Launch USD payouts to non core geos
initiatives.pillar: Users can send USD payout to multiple geographies across the world

initiatives.name: Stablecoin: Launch USD to COP payout
initiatives.pillar: Enable payout for US businesses to send to COP using Cobre Routefusion

initiatives.name: Stablecoin: Create RF individual accounts for Jeeves stablecoin flow of funds
Stablecoin: Postman APIs for balance and transfers from Bridge 1P
Stablecoin: If 1P has insufficient balance, keep interwallet transfers as pending
Stablecoin: Interwallet transfer (wallet to wallet, using the default AWX flow)
Stablecoin: Bridge vs. Jeeves Reconciliation
initiatives.pillar: (a) matching reports, (b) figuring out missing transactions, (c) deposit matching w/ metadata)

initiatives.name: Treasury Management in CMS
initiatives.pillar:
Internal work for Treasury management enablement
1. Internal alert if balance is less than payment amount
2. Show balance of every 1P account in CMS
3. Initiate money movement between 1Ps from CMS

initiatives.name: CMS: DB Stability Risk from Card Transaction Page
initiatives.pillar: Internal task for controlling stability risk on CMS API calls

initiatives.name: Reimbursements feature available without a funding source when mode is external
Identify queries DMS task adding load to DB
Vendor Owner Assignation UX for Existing Vendors
initiatives.pillar:
1. Makes vendor ownership visible and easy to manage by adding a clear column and in-profile controls.
2. Allows bulk assignment of vendor owners, eliminating the need to update vendors one by one.
3. Improves AP workflows by ensuring vendor owners are assigned before approval policies step up.
4 Reduces friction by letting users invite new owners directly when assigning them.

initiatives.name: QiTech SF Account Rejection Webhook Support
initiatives.pillar: Handle rejection webhook for QiTech (BE only)

initiatives.name: Bills Inbox Expansion for ERP Bill Sync
initiatives.pillar:
1. Unified bill visibility: View SAT and ERP bills together in one place for complete payables oversight.
2. Less AP manual work: Automatically import open and partially paid bills from your ERP – no manual re-entry.
3. Faster payments: Pay ERP or SAT bills directly through Jeeves in a few clicks.
4. Accurate reconciliation: Payments sync back to the ERP automatically, keeping records aligned.

initiatives.name: Stablecoin: Use USDB / EURC account as source of funds for Cards for US and EUR Geos
initiatives.pillar:
Move card volume, for US businesses, to USDB (away from AWX);

Move card volume, for EU businesses, to EURC (away from AWX)

initiatives.name: Data quality and governance - new pipeline this and this
Card “Timeline” audit trail for key card changes
initiatives.pillar:
1. Full change transparency – view a clear, chronological history of all key card actions to instantly understand how a card evolved over time.
2. Faster issue resolution – help admins, finance, and support teams quickly answer “what changed, when, and by whom” without manual investigation.
3. Stronger governance & accountability – create an immutable audit trail for card limits, controls, and lifecycle changes to support internal controls and compliance.
4. Operational clarity at scale – reduce confusion and miscommunication by centralizing all card-related changes in a single, easy-to-scan timeline.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Finish Approval Chain Component for Trip Requests
initiatives.pillar:
1. End-to-end transparency – Requesters and approvers can clearly see who the request is waiting on, who comes next, and what’s already approved.
2. Reduced follow-ups and confusion – Eliminates out-of-band messages like “Who has this?” or “Am I blocking this?” by making approval status explicit in-product.
3. Faster, more predictable approvals – Approvers understand their role in the chain and can act confidently without uncertainty about downstream steps.
4. Enterprise-grade governance – Admins can trust that the visible approval chain accurately reflects policy configuration, improving auditability and control.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Implement Trip Request Email Notifications with Key Details
initiatives.pillar:
1. Faster approvals – Approvers receive clear, actionable emails with all relevant trip details, reducing delays and missed requests.
2. Less back-and-forth – Requesters are immediately notified of approvals or declines (with reasons), eliminating follow-ups outside the platform.
3. Better decision context – Emails include policy, dates, traveler info, and budget so approvers can act confidently without logging in first.
4. More reliable workflows – Real-time, role-specific notifications ensure the right people are notified at the right time with no duplicates or confusion.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Approve or Decline Trip Requests Directly from Email
initiatives.pillar:
1. Faster decisions for time-sensitive travel – Approvers can act immediately from their inbox without needing to log into Jeeves.
2. Reduced approval friction – One-click approve/decline actions eliminate unnecessary context switching and delays.
3. Clear, auditable outcomes – All email-based actions are securely logged with approver identity and timestamps for full traceability.
4. Seamless workflow continuity – Requests update instantly in Jeeves, notify the requester, and move to the next approver when applicable.

initiatives.name: Brazil SCR (Monthly Monitoring)"
initiatives.pillar: No visible improvement from a customer's perspective. Though, it will help us optimize on data pull and cost efficiency

initiatives.name: Mobile Card Controls (View only)
initiatives.pillar:
1. At-a-glance awareness – employees can instantly review card status, limits, and MCC restrictions from mobile without needing web access.
2. Transparency – finance teams and cardholders share the same real-time visibility into card details, improving alignment on spend policy.
3. Reduced support dependency – self-service visibility minimizes “what’s my limit?” and “is my card active?” inquiries.
4. Foundation for controls – lays the groundwork for interactive card management (freeze, limits, MCC edits) in future releases.

initiatives.name: AI Setup Automation: Phase 1: FTU & Upload Anything
initiatives.pillar: This will considerably simplify the currently manual and confusing process of setting up a company's accounting information so that they can immediately begin to get value out of the Accounting features.

initiatives.name: Factura & Card Transaction Matching
initiatives.pillar: 1. Operational excellence - customers can rely on rules and AI to automatically match SAT bills to card transactions.

initiatives.name: Mexico Bundle: Syntage Re-connection & Promissory Notes
initiatives.pillar: Better customer experience by embedding the need to capture the appropriate consent at the time of onboarding

initiatives.name: Jeeves Platform Fee via Pricing Engine
initiatives.pillar:
1. Instant activation – Customers gain access to all Gold features (Reimbursements, MCC, Factura, Cashback) immediately after signing, without waiting for manual Ops intervention.
2. Accurate, transparent billing – Automated fee and overage tracking ensures every charge, cashback, and expiration is handled precisely—no surprises or missed rewards.
3. Seamless experience – A single, smooth transition from Basic to Gold eliminates delays, errors, and back-and-forth emails during onboarding.
4. Smarter in-platform visibility – Basic admins see relevant Gold prompts in-app, helping them understand the value of upgrading and unlocking advanced features effortlessly.

initiatives.name: Simplify Roles + Permissions and make Member drawer editable by default (remove “Edit” step)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Instant clarity on user access – Finance teams can see exactly what a user can do in one place, without navigating or decoding multiple sections.
2. Faster, safer access changes – Roles and permissions can be adjusted immediately from the member drawer, reducing friction and admin overhead.
3. Reduced admin errors and rework – Clear role descriptions and visible permissions eliminate guesswork and prevent over- or under-provisioning.
4. Stronger governance with less effort – Always-visible permissions make access decisions explainable and auditable without slowing daily operations.

initiatives.name: R3 _ Reimbursement upgrades (adding factura generation)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Full compliance – reimbursements now support SAT Factura generation for tax-valid expense reporting in Mexico.
2. Unified workflows – employees can manage both card and personal spend in one consistent flow.
3. Reduced manual work – eliminates the need to upload external XML or PDF facturas separately.
4. Better audit readiness – finance teams have centralized visibility of all SAT-compliant spend, including reimbursements.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1 - Post Action on approval (create card, increase limit)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Instant enablement – Once a travel or spend request is approved, the employee automatically receives the tools they need (card or higher limit) without waiting for manual processing.
2. Reduced admin workload – Finance teams no longer need to manually create cards or adjust limits after every approved request.
3. Frictionless employee experience – Approvals translate directly into action, improving turnaround time for trips, events, or high-value purchases.
4. Consistent policy enforcement – Every post-approval action adheres to predefined rules, ensuring spend control and audit readiness across all approvals.

initiatives.name: Merchant allowed and blocked lists
initiatives.pillar:
1.Granular control – define card permissions at the individual merchant level for precise spend governance.
2. Enhanced fraud protection – block high-risk or unauthorized merchants instantly to reduce exposure.
3. Policy flexibility – apply allow/block rules dynamically during card creation or through reusable policy lists.
4. Operational consistency – ensure organization-wide compliance through centrally managed, reusable merchant lists.

initiatives.name: Zendesk updates: no more needing of providing data when zendesk is opened by an autenticated session + outverse integration + this ticket
initiatives.pillar:
1. Personalized experience – logged-in clients are instantly recognized, eliminating repetitive questions about email, region, or role.
2. Faster support resolution – authenticated user data (region, role, verified phone, etc.) is passed automatically into Zendesk tickets.
3. Localized onboarding for visitors – non-logged users see tailored chat flows per country and language for better regional engagement.
4. Streamlined integration – Outverse connects directly with CMS and Zendesk, ensuring seamless data flow and reducing manual agent effort.

initiatives.name: Replace Heron with LLM
initiatives.pillar:
1. Clear transaction visibility – surface clean, recognizable merchant names so cardholders instantly understand their spend.
2. Faster reconciliation – eliminate guesswork from raw, processor-heavy merchant strings during expense review.
3. Reduced support load – minimize disputes and inquiries caused by unrecognized or confusing merchant names.
4. Cost efficiency – replace Heron with a scalable LLM-based approach to significantly lower monthly processing costs.
5. Quality control at scale – monitor and refine merchant cleaning output through a real-time lookup dashboard.

initiatives.name: Email Receipt Forwarding
initiatives.pillar: Competitors (e.g., Clara, Ramp) are promoting “email-based” expense reconciliation. We should not support “read your emails” or inbox access due to trust, security, and perception concerns.Instead, we want a forward-only email ingestion flow, functionally equivalent to our WhatsApp receipt flow, that allows users to forward receipts or invoices to a dedicated Jeeves email address and have them automatically matched to the correct transaction.This should be framed and implemented as “forward your receipt”

initiatives.name: Accounting UI Improvements and Feature Engagement
initiatives.pillar: Improve the engagement with the Accounting page by introducing highly asked for UI improvements to usability

initiatives.name: Accounting Redshift Migration
initiatives.pillar: Tech Debt. Migrating the accounting tables to RedShift will allow for cleaner implementations going forward, as well as less errors

initiatives.name: AI Setup Automation: Phase 2: Auto-Mapping
initiatives.pillar: This will considerably simplify the currently manual and confusing process of setting up a company's accounting information so that they can immediately begin to get value out of the Accounting features.

initiatives.name: Match receipts to card transactions via WhatsApp
initiatives.pillar:
1. Frictionless receipt capture – upload receipts instantly from mobile without searching for the related transaction first.
2. Automatic matching – use OCR to extract key data and intelligently attach receipts to the correct card transaction.
3. Cleaner expense reviews – reduce manual follow-ups by ensuring receipts are correctly linked at the time of upload.
4. No lost receipts – store unmatched receipts in a dedicated holding area for later action.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Add Budget Estimation to Trip Request Flow
initiatives.pillar:
1. Faster, higher-confidence approvals – Approvers see an estimated trip cost upfront, reducing back-and-forth questions and approval delays.
2. More complete requests from employees – Employees submit approval-ready requests with clear financial context, aligning expectations early.
3. More consistent decision-making – Budget visibility helps approvers quickly judge reasonableness and policy alignment across requests.
4. Stronger audit and spend tracking foundation – Captured budget estimates are stored for audit history and future comparison against actual spend.

initiatives.name: USD/MXN - M2 migration
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to migrate companies from Jeeves 1.0 to Jeeves 3.0.

initiatives.name: Cards Production Health (M2)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to analyse and fix bugs in production.

initiatives.name: Cards API: Onboarding (M2)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to onboard new customers to Jeeves Cards API.

initiatives.name: Pricing Plan: Platform Fee for SF customers
initiatives.pillar: 1. Implement the rules to charge platform fee from SF customers.

initiatives.name: Real-time Fraud Verification
initiatives.pillar:
1. Card declines due to fraud verification is a point of friction with our customers and a recurrent complaint to customer support.
2. Allow the cardholder to self-unblock when they recognize a transaction declined by fraud verification.

initiatives.name: DeductAjustment & LoadAdjustment Rules
initiatives.pillar:
1. A customer should not have any pending transactions for more than 30 days.
2. By solving pending transactions, we guarantee that customers won't have pending transactions locking their CL.

initiatives.name: World Elite in LATAM
initiatives.pillar: 1. Premium card with enhanced benefits, mainly targeting company owners and c-level employees.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Show Users Assigned to Each Policy in Policy Manager
initiatives.pillar:
1. Instant visibility into policy impact – Admins can immediately see how many users are governed by a policy without navigating away or cross-referencing settings.
2. Safer policy changes – Clear user assignment visibility helps admins confidently edit, deactivate, or delete policies without accidentally affecting active users.
3. Reduced admin effort – Eliminates manual checks across teams and settings, saving time especially for large orgs or temporary policies.
4. Improved auditability and governance – Real-time user lists make it easier to validate policy configuration and demonstrate control during reviews or audits.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1- Manage Policy Members Directly from Policy Screen
initiatives.pillar:
1. Faster policy updates – Admins can add or remove users without leaving the policy screen, reducing friction and context switching.
2. Safer exception handling – Quick member changes make it easier to handle temporary travel exceptions or short-term policies without mistakes.
3. Immediate enforcement confidence – Changes take effect instantly and are reflected everywhere the policy applies, reducing uncertainty.
4. Lower admin overhead – Streamlined member management cuts down on repetitive navigation and manual coordination for policy changes.

initiatives.name: Travel agent V1.1-Improve Copy When Deactivating or Deleting Policies with Assigned Users
initiatives.pillar:
1. Immediate clarity on blocked actions – Admins clearly understand why a policy cannot be deactivated or deleted when users are still assigned.
2. Reduced frustration and retries – Explicit messaging eliminates confusion and prevents repeated failed attempts or support tickets.
3. Guided resolution – Clear copy tells admins exactly what to do next (remove or reassign users) to complete the action successfully.
4. More consistent policy management experience – Uniform messaging across deactivate and delete flows improves usability and trust in the system.

initiatives.name: B2B Pay: Implement file exchange to unlock partnership
initiatives.pillar: 1. B2B Pay is the second largest payment processor for travel in Brazil, so a new source to acquire customers and expand our VCN product.

initiatives.name: Cards API: Webhook Support
initiatives.pillar:
1. At the moment of the transaction, our VCN customer will subscribe and receive notifications with the corresponding status.
2. It's the trigger to solve potential issues with their vendors.

initiatives.name: Colombia MB invoicing report
initiatives.pillar: Internal enablement task for Colombian customers invoicing process

initiatives.name: MX Invoicing Report for SOFOM orgs
initiatives.pillar: Create and maintain a SOFOM-specific invoice template/query for Mexico, aligned to the existing MX template.

initiatives.name: LLM Translation of Payment Failures to Customer-Readable Messages
initiatives.pillar: AI driven customer facing messages for payment failures based on the technical error code and message shared by our payment processing partners

initiatives.name: In-Progress Status for Stablecoin Deposits
initiatives.pillar: Reduce customer anxiety and support burden by clearly signaling when a stablecoin deposit has been received by Bridge but is still undergoing FX conversion, instead of appearing “missing” for 10–30 minutes.

initiatives.name: Support for Saudi Arabia, Egypt and Israel payouts (local and USD)
initiatives.pillar: Enable payment flows to Saudi Arabia, Egypt and Israel payouts (local and USD)

initiatives.name: Failed Payment investigation agent (internal)
initiatives.pillar: AI agent that automatically investigates every failed payment across logs, traces, and DB state, identifies the most likely root cause, and proactively surfaces a structured diagnosis to Engineering via Slack.

initiatives.name: Payments Agent: In-Line Vendor Creation from Bulk Upload
initiatives.pillar:
1. Customer uploads any file, any format: No need to reformat bulk payment files to adap to the Jeeves template.
2. Automatic vendor matching & creation: Reduces manual work and speeds setup – bridgin the gap between vendor management and bulk pay.

initiatives.name: Next-Gen Invoice Forwarding (Per-Entity Inboxes)
initiatives.pillar: Enable reliable, zero-ambiguity invoice forwarding for multi-entity customers by introducing dedicated invoice inboxes per entity, while preserving existing bill creation behavior.

initiatives.name: Accounts Page design update
initiatives.pillar:
Make stablecoin usage feel first‑class, intuitive, and purpose‑built for cross‑border money movement — not a workaround on top of vendor payments.

Remove ambiguity between *accounts, wallets, payments, conversions, and withdrawals* in the stablecoin experience.

initiatives.name: Crypto Onramp (USDC/USDT)
initiatives.pillar: Enable customers to fund their Bridge stablecoin wallets by sending **USDC** or **USDT** directly. Expose crypto account wallet details in the "Account details for funding"

initiatives.name: Manual transfers between 3P Stablecoin Accounts
initiatives.pillar: Enable a manual workaround (no UI, BE execution via APIs only) to allow customers to transfer funds between customer 3P wallets

initiatives.name: “Run Your AP on Jeeves” Interactive Demo
initiatives.pillar: A lightweight, guided AP demo accessible directly in-product, so Treasury users see Jeeves as an end-to-end AP system

initiatives.name: Progressive AP Policy Nudges
initiatives.pillar: Progressively guide customers from Payments-only → Governed Payments → Full AP workflows, without forcing upfront complexity. This first release focuses on driving Payment Release Policy adoption for customers with no governance.

initiatives.name: Automate Collection Fee Application
initiatives.pillar: Automatically determine the customer’s outstanding balance at the end of Day 15 of the new billing cycle, in order to consistently calculate and apply a 10% Collection Fee on that amount across CO and BR.

initiatives.name: 28 cycles CO: Automate Jeeves Pay Interest Collection on Grace Period  (7 Days)
initiatives.pillar: This replaces the current manual Ops process and is a prerequisite to scaling to 28 billing cycles in Colombia.

initiatives.name: Convert funds enhancement
initiatives.pillar: Elevate the Convert Funds into a first-class wallet capability with a redesigned flow that enables bi-directional amount input with real-time rate calculation.

initiatives.name: 28 cycles CO: Pending Transactions at Statement Cutoff (High Risk Area)
initiatives.pillar: Implement a billing-day cutoff time to shift late payments to the next business day, effectively minimizing pending transaction risks with low technical effort but high customer friction.

initiatives.name: MX: Self Funded Payments powered by Direct Debit (Druo)
initiatives.pillar: Allow MX customers to initiate local or cross-border payments funded directly from an external bank account, instead of using Jeeves Credit or Self-Funded balances.

initiatives.name: Mobile Reimbursements
initiatives.pillar:
1. Submit on the go – create, edit and track reimbursement requests from the phone with receipt upload.
2. Faster approvals – approvers act from mobile; status updates reduce back‑and‑forth.
3. Fewer mistakes – policy‑aware forms improve first‑pass success.
4. Audit‑ready – timestamps, receipts and approval trails are stored for compliance.

initiatives.name: UI Improvement: Card Claiming & Card Activation
initiatives.pillar: 1. Give evidence to card claiming and card activation, so users can quickly take aciton on their physical cards.

initiatives.name: JP Flow Design Rework
initiatives.pillar: Redesign the current JP Flow, to make it an efficient bill payment flow we're all proud of

initiatives.name: CO: Self Funded Payments powered by PSE (Partner TBC)
initiatives.pillar: Enable Colombian customers to pay local vendors using their own funds collected via PSE.

initiatives.name: Vendor documents and support in the platform
initiatives.pillar: Have the ability to attach documents to the vendor’s profile—such as tax IDs, contracts, agreements, NDAs, and other documents required by local regulations for each entity. This can help avoid losing any information and ensures it is always accessible in case of an audit or an urgent request.

initiatives.name: Vendor Management Policy
initiatives.pillar:
1. Strengthens security by requiring approval for new vendors and sensitive changes like bank info or tax IDs.
2. Reduces fraud and data-quality issues through structured oversight tied to vendor owners and admins.
3. Improves visibility and control with a dedicated “Pending Vendor Approvals” section and full audit trails.

initiatives.name: VCN: Card Spend Limit in Foreign Currency
initiatives.pillar:
1. VCN customers will be able to define the card spend limit in foreign currency, ideally matching the reservation amount.
2. For international bookings, customers will be able to match the merchant currency with the card spend limit.

initiatives.name: Apple Pay & Google Pay
initiatives.pillar:
1. Instant "In-Person" Power for Virtual Cards: by integrating with digital wallets, customers can instantly issue a virtual card  and use it in brick-and-mortar stores.
2. Enhanced Security via Tokenization & Biometrics: Apple and Google Pay replace sensitive card numbers with an unique encrypted token for every transaction.
3. Frictionless Travel & Expense Experience: Digital wallets allow for contactless payment without fumbling for a wallet or entering PINs.

initiatives.name: Revisit logic for capturing approved vs not-required payment statuses
initiatives.pillar:
1. Improved data integrity – approvals now accurately reflect whether a payment passed through a JP policy.
2. Clearer reporting – analytics and dashboards can reliably separate policy-driven approvals from bypassed cases.
3. Better compliance tracking – finance teams gain visibility into true policy enforcement rates.
4. Reliable automation – downstream triggers (e.g., reconciliations, alerts) now execute only on genuinely approved payments.

initiatives.name: Pricing Plan: Fees for Card ATM Withdrawals
initiatives.pillar: 1. Give transparency to customers on how much they're being charged for ATM transactions.

initiatives.name: Stablecoin: COP Onramp
initiatives.pillar: Build with dLocal the ability to accept COP and convert to USDB

initiatives.name: Installments in Brazil with Paymentology
initiatives.pillar: 1. Unlock Brazilian customers to pay with credit card in installments, capturing larger purchases.

initiatives.name: USD/MXN - M3 migration
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to migrate companies from Jeeves 1.0 to Jeeves 3.0.

initiatives.name: Cards Production Health (M3)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to analyse and fix bugs in production.

initiatives.name: Cards API: Onboarding (M3)
initiatives.pillar: Recurrent project to onboard new customers to Jeeves Cards API.

initiatives.name: Card Replacement with ABU File
initiatives.pillar:
1. Allow the user to replace a card without having to cancel and request a new card.
2. Create a seamless experience for virtual and physical cards, including World Elite.
3. When a card is replaced, update all card on file merchants with the new card number - ABU file.

initiatives.name: POC - U/W data pipelines in Colombia  (DIAN integration, provider Konvex?)
initiatives.pillar: DIAN, Colombia's tax authority, for retrival of Colombian businesses tax and revenue data for a potentially higher credit limit

initiatives.name: POC - U/W integration in Brazil for Duplicates / Card Receivables - (CERC integration)
initiatives.pillar: Ability to increase credit limit by securitizing the customers' dupulicatas / card receivables

initiatives.name: Fraud and security:  move 3DS to the app from SMS
initiatives.pillar:
1. Stronger protection – in-app 3DS removes exposure to SIM-swap and SMS interception attacks.
2. Faster checkout – users approve transactions instantly within the app, without waiting for a code.
3. Higher completion rates – fewer timeouts or failed authentications improve transaction success.
4. Consistent global UX – one unified, app-based flow across all regions and devices.

initiatives.name: New Finance Team Member role
initiatives.pillar:
1. Grant precise access without over-permissioning Give finance and ops teammates access to AP, reimbursements, and spend visibility without full admin rights.
2. Scale finance workflows as teams grow Support mid-tier roles like AP and reimbursement managers without routing all work through a single admin.
3. Reduce risk while maintaining control Keep admin-only settings locked down while enabling day-to-day finance operations.
4. Simplify onboarding and role management Assign the right access at invite or edit, with clear role labels and configurable permissions.

initiatives.name: Employee role — default optional permissions OFF (and reset when switching to Employee)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Grant precise access without over-permissioning Give finance and ops teammates access to AP, reimbursements, and spend visibility without full admin rights.
2. Scale finance workflows as teams grow Support mid-tier roles like AP and reimbursement managers without routing all work through a single admin.
3. Reduce risk while maintaining control Keep admin-only settings locked down while enabling day-to-day finance operations.
4. Simplify onboarding and role management Assign the right access at invite or edit, with clear role labels and configurable permissions.

initiatives.name: Bookkeeper role consistency
initiatives.pillar:
1. Treat bookkeepers as first-class finance users Align the Bookkeeper role with other core roles, matching customer expectations for internal finance teams.
2. Enable flexible role changes over time Allow bookkeepers to be reassigned to other roles as responsibilities evolve.
3. Remove unexpected card restrictions Ensure card eligibility follows permission logic, not hard role-type blocks.
4. Reduce confusion in role management Present Bookkeeper as a standard role in role selection, improving clarity and admin confidence.

initiatives.name: Bulk card control editing
initiatives.pillar:
1. Time savings – update dozens or hundreds of cards in seconds instead of one-by-one.
2. Error reduction – bulk confirmation and audit logging prevent inconsistent manual edits.
3. Stronger control – enforce company-wide or department-level spend policies instantly.
4. Operational flexibility – temporary or recurring changes (e.g., during events or campaigns) can be applied in bulk without IT involvement.

initiatives.name: “Can create and manage card spend limits” permission
initiatives.pillar:
1. Granular access control – delegate card issuance and limit management without granting full admin or treasury access.
2. Improved security – supports least-privilege principles, reducing the risk of unauthorized access or configuration changes.
3. Simpler delegation – permissions can be granted per user directly from the Teams → Members page.
4. Future-ready framework – establishes a unified permission model that integrates seamlessly with other upcoming access-based features (e.g., Policies & Approvals).

initiatives.name: Card Upgrade with ABU File
initiatives.pillar: 1. Allow the customer to upgrade the card from regular physical card to World Elite without having to cancel the card.

initiatives.name: Fraud and security:  new MFA implementation with code rendered on screen (like github and google)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Stronger account protection – on-screen MFA codes greatly reduce risks of phishing or message interception.
2. Modernized experience – familiar, secure verification flow consistent with trusted platforms like GitHub and Google.
3. Faster authentication – eliminates delays caused by email or SMS delivery failures.
4. Higher reliability – ensures users can always complete MFA, even if communication channels are unavailable.

initiatives.name: Surface AI Receipt Match Evaluation in Transaction Modal
initiatives.pillar:
Instant Confidence in Receipt Accuracy
Customers can immediately see whether a receipt matches the transaction, reducing guesswork and manual verification.

Faster Close and Easier Audits
Early detection of mismatched receipts minimizes back-and-forth during month-end close and audit reviews.

Stronger Compliance Without Added Friction
AI-driven validation improves control and accuracy without blocking cardholders or adding extra workflow steps.

initiatives.name: Multi Org Experience (Phase 0)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Single-session finance workflows – access statements and transactions across all orgs without repeated logins or context switching.
2. Faster month-end close – export statements and transactions per org or across orgs in one flow while preserving entity-level identifiers.
3. Reduced operational repetition – eliminate org-by-org manual work for high-frequency accounting tasks.
4. Lower risk of accounting errors – maintain clear org context across views and exports to prevent cross-entity mistakes.

initiatives.name: Employee Card Transaction Categorization
initiatives.pillar:
1. Cleaner spend attribution at source – enable employees to categorize transactions by department, location, and custom fields at the time of purchase.
2. Reduced accounting rework – minimize manual corrections by allowing bookkeepers and admins to review and override categorizations only when needed.
3. Stronger policy compliance – enforce mandatory categorization through policies to ensure every transaction is properly tagged.
4. Improved adoption for multi-location orgs – support real-world operational structures (departments, locations) to make Jeeves viable for complex spend management use cases.

initiatives.name: Post card transactions approvals
initiatives.pillar:
1. Stronger spend control without slowing teams – review and approve expenses after the transaction using configurable, multi-layer approval flows.
2. Review by exception – automatically route only out-of-policy, high-value, or anomalous transactions for approval to reduce manager workload.
3. Faster, clearer resolution – give managers and admins all context (receipt, notes, flags) in one place to approve or reject expenses quickly.
4. Enterprise-grade compliance at scale – enforce consistent approval rules across teams, regions, and currencies while maintaining a simple employee experience.

initiatives.name: R3 _ Spend management basics - User Limits (Employee Budget)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Unified spend control – manage all of an employee’s card spend through a single, consolidated budget.
2. Greater flexibility – set one-time or recurring budgets that automatically reset per period.
3. Transparency & accountability – real-time notifications show when a decline is due to budget or card limit.
4. Simplified management – adjust budgets directly from the Teams page without changing card limits.

initiatives.name: Vendor Management Policy (Claudio will drive policy definition and Money team will introduce the concept of vendor in status pending)
initiatives.pillar:
1. Stronger vendor governance – critical vendor creations and edits require explicit approval, minimizing fraud and compliance risks.
2. Smarter routing – approvals are automatically directed to the vendor owner’s manager or default admin, ensuring accountability without slowing operations.
3. End-to-end visibility – pending changes, approvals, and audit trails are all visible in one place for easy tracking and review.
4. Transparent notifications – vendor owners and approvers receive automatic alerts for edits, approvals, and pending items, keeping all stakeholders informed.

initiatives.name: Niva Onboarding Automation
initiatives.pillar: This integration will allow up to fill in the majority of a users application for them, without error, allowing for a much faster and accurate onboarding experience.

initiatives.name: SAP S4Hana Integration
initiatives.pillar: Introduce an SAP Accounting integration, unlocking large players in the market that require an integration to confidently use the Jeeves platform.

initiatives.name: NetSuite Partnership
initiatives.pillar: Become an official NetSuite partner app in LatAm, allowing for NetSuite customers to discover us through the NetSuite platform as an official cards + payment solution.

initiatives.name: CMS Tighter Controls
initiatives.pillar: Mitigate Audit & Financial risk by implementing "Maker/Checker" approvals for Credit Limit changes.

initiatives.name: Pluggy Integration
initiatives.pillar: Customers don't have to provide bank statements and more customers can now be eligible for larger proactive CLIs with this data

initiatives.name: Enable CREAM experience for all customers (USD Credit)
Enforce invoice Policies
initiatives.pillar:
1. Stronger spend controls: Bills above the threshold cannot be sent without an invoice, reducing policy violations.
2. Reduced risk of errors or non-compliance: Mandatory enforcement ensures all required documentation is attached before approval.
3. Clear guidance for users: Red banners and error states provide immediate feedback, minimizing confusion.

initiatives.name: Multi-Org Phase 1: Cross-Org Statements & Transactions
initiatives.pillar: 1. Faster month-end close: Finance teams can access statements and transactions across all orgs without logging in and out of each entity.                                                                      2. Reduced operational overhead: Export transactions across orgs with clear entity identifiers, eliminating repeated manual workflows.                                                                     3. Lower accounting risk: Clear org/entity context in UI and exports reduces reconciliation errors for multi-entity companies.

initiatives.name: Multi-Org Phase 2: Finance Visibility & Treasury
initiatives.pillar: 1. Executive visibility: CFOs and finance leaders can see balances, credit exposure, and spend across entities in one place.                                             2. Treasury efficiency: Faster decision-making with clear cross-org liquidity visibility and safe drill-downs to org-level actions.                                                                                     3. Stronger governance: Clear separation between visibility and execution preserves auditability while improving control.”

Unknown / Not Set.pillar:

2. Unified experience: Pay all boletos — vendor invoices and utility bills — from the same Jeeves flow.
3. Better visibility: All boleto payments consolidated in one place for tracking and reconciliation.
4. Operational simplicity: No need to manage separate processes or vendors for recolhimento payments.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Bill Pay reconciliation for NetSuite and non-ERP
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: This will allow customers to differentiate their bill payments from their card expenses during reconciliation, and sync these transactions correctly into their ERP.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar:

2. Less AP manual work: Automatically import open and partially paid bills from your ERP – no manual re-entry.
3. Faster payments: Pay ERP or SAT bills directly through Jeeves in a few clicks.
4. Accurate reconciliation: Payments sync back to the ERP automatically, keeping records aligned.

Move card volume, for US businesses, to USDB (away from AWX);

Move card volume, for EU businesses, to EURC (away from AWX)

Unknown / Not Set.name: Data quality and governance - new pipeline this and this
Card “Timeline” audit trail for key card changes
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Full change transparency – view a clear, chronological history of all key card actions to instantly understand how a card evolved over time.
2. Faster issue resolution – help admins, finance, and support teams quickly answer “what changed, when, and by whom” without manual investigation.
3. Stronger governance & accountability – create an immutable audit trail for card limits, controls, and lifecycle changes to support internal controls and compliance.
4. Operational clarity at scale – reduce confusion and miscommunication by centralizing all card-related changes in a single, easy-to-scan timeline.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Finish Approval Chain Component for Trip Requests
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. End-to-end transparency – Requesters and approvers can clearly see who the request is waiting on, who comes next, and what’s already approved.
2. Reduced follow-ups and confusion – Eliminates out-of-band messages like “Who has this?” or “Am I blocking this?” by making approval status explicit in-product.
3. Faster, more predictable approvals – Approvers understand their role in the chain and can act confidently without uncertainty about downstream steps.
4. Enterprise-grade governance – Admins can trust that the visible approval chain accurately reflects policy configuration, improving auditability and control.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Implement Trip Request Email Notifications with Key Details
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Faster approvals – Approvers receive clear, actionable emails with all relevant trip details, reducing delays and missed requests.
2. Less back-and-forth – Requesters are immediately notified of approvals or declines (with reasons), eliminating follow-ups outside the platform.
3. Better decision context – Emails include policy, dates, traveler info, and budget so approvers can act confidently without logging in first.
4. More reliable workflows – Real-time, role-specific notifications ensure the right people are notified at the right time with no duplicates or confusion.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Approve or Decline Trip Requests Directly from Email
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Faster decisions for time-sensitive travel – Approvers can act immediately from their inbox without needing to log into Jeeves.
2. Reduced approval friction – One-click approve/decline actions eliminate unnecessary context switching and delays.
3. Clear, auditable outcomes – All email-based actions are securely logged with approver identity and timestamps for full traceability.
4. Seamless workflow continuity – Requests update instantly in Jeeves, notify the requester, and move to the next approver when applicable.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Brazil SCR (Monthly Monitoring)"
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: No visible improvement from a customer's perspective. Though, it will help us optimize on data pull and cost efficiency

Unknown / Not Set.name: Mobile Card Controls (View only)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. At-a-glance awareness – employees can instantly review card status, limits, and MCC restrictions from mobile without needing web access.
2. Transparency – finance teams and cardholders share the same real-time visibility into card details, improving alignment on spend policy.
3. Reduced support dependency – self-service visibility minimizes “what’s my limit?” and “is my card active?” inquiries.
4. Foundation for controls – lays the groundwork for interactive card management (freeze, limits, MCC edits) in future releases.

Unknown / Not Set.name: AI Setup Automation: Phase 1: FTU & Upload Anything
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: This will considerably simplify the currently manual and confusing process of setting up a company's accounting information so that they can immediately begin to get value out of the Accounting features.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Factura & Card Transaction Matching
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Operational excellence - customers can rely on rules and AI to automatically match SAT bills to card transactions.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Mexico Bundle: Syntage Re-connection & Promissory Notes
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Better customer experience by embedding the need to capture the appropriate consent at the time of onboarding

Unknown / Not Set.name: Jeeves Platform Fee via Pricing Engine
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Instant activation – Customers gain access to all Gold features (Reimbursements, MCC, Factura, Cashback) immediately after signing, without waiting for manual Ops intervention.
2. Accurate, transparent billing – Automated fee and overage tracking ensures every charge, cashback, and expiration is handled precisely—no surprises or missed rewards.
3. Seamless experience – A single, smooth transition from Basic to Gold eliminates delays, errors, and back-and-forth emails during onboarding.
4. Smarter in-platform visibility – Basic admins see relevant Gold prompts in-app, helping them understand the value of upgrading and unlocking advanced features effortlessly.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Simplify Roles + Permissions and make Member drawer editable by default (remove “Edit” step)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Instant clarity on user access – Finance teams can see exactly what a user can do in one place, without navigating or decoding multiple sections.
2. Faster, safer access changes – Roles and permissions can be adjusted immediately from the member drawer, reducing friction and admin overhead.
3. Reduced admin errors and rework – Clear role descriptions and visible permissions eliminate guesswork and prevent over- or under-provisioning.
4. Stronger governance with less effort – Always-visible permissions make access decisions explainable and auditable without slowing daily operations.

Unknown / Not Set.name: R3 _ Reimbursement upgrades (adding factura generation)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Full compliance – reimbursements now support SAT Factura generation for tax-valid expense reporting in Mexico.
2. Unified workflows – employees can manage both card and personal spend in one consistent flow.
3. Reduced manual work – eliminates the need to upload external XML or PDF facturas separately.
4. Better audit readiness – finance teams have centralized visibility of all SAT-compliant spend, including reimbursements.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1 - Post Action on approval (create card, increase limit)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Instant enablement – Once a travel or spend request is approved, the employee automatically receives the tools they need (card or higher limit) without waiting for manual processing.
2. Reduced admin workload – Finance teams no longer need to manually create cards or adjust limits after every approved request.
3. Frictionless employee experience – Approvals translate directly into action, improving turnaround time for trips, events, or high-value purchases.
4. Consistent policy enforcement – Every post-approval action adheres to predefined rules, ensuring spend control and audit readiness across all approvals.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Merchant allowed and blocked lists
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1.Granular control – define card permissions at the individual merchant level for precise spend governance.
2. Enhanced fraud protection – block high-risk or unauthorized merchants instantly to reduce exposure.
3. Policy flexibility – apply allow/block rules dynamically during card creation or through reusable policy lists.
4. Operational consistency – ensure organization-wide compliance through centrally managed, reusable merchant lists.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Zendesk updates: no more needing of providing data when zendesk is opened by an autenticated session + outverse integration + this ticket
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Personalized experience – logged-in clients are instantly recognized, eliminating repetitive questions about email, region, or role.
2. Faster support resolution – authenticated user data (region, role, verified phone, etc.) is passed automatically into Zendesk tickets.
3. Localized onboarding for visitors – non-logged users see tailored chat flows per country and language for better regional engagement.
4. Streamlined integration – Outverse connects directly with CMS and Zendesk, ensuring seamless data flow and reducing manual agent effort.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Replace Heron with LLM
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Clear transaction visibility – surface clean, recognizable merchant names so cardholders instantly understand their spend.
2. Faster reconciliation – eliminate guesswork from raw, processor-heavy merchant strings during expense review.
3. Reduced support load – minimize disputes and inquiries caused by unrecognized or confusing merchant names.
4. Cost efficiency – replace Heron with a scalable LLM-based approach to significantly lower monthly processing costs.
5. Quality control at scale – monitor and refine merchant cleaning output through a real-time lookup dashboard.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Email Receipt Forwarding
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Competitors (e.g., Clara, Ramp) are promoting “email-based” expense reconciliation. We should not support “read your emails” or inbox access due to trust, security, and perception concerns.Instead, we want a forward-only email ingestion flow, functionally equivalent to our WhatsApp receipt flow, that allows users to forward receipts or invoices to a dedicated Jeeves email address and have them automatically matched to the correct transaction.This should be framed and implemented as “forward your receipt”

Unknown / Not Set.name: Accounting UI Improvements and Feature Engagement
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Improve the engagement with the Accounting page by introducing highly asked for UI improvements to usability

Unknown / Not Set.name: Accounting Redshift Migration
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Tech Debt. Migrating the accounting tables to RedShift will allow for cleaner implementations going forward, as well as less errors

Unknown / Not Set.name: AI Setup Automation: Phase 2: Auto-Mapping
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: This will considerably simplify the currently manual and confusing process of setting up a company's accounting information so that they can immediately begin to get value out of the Accounting features.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Match receipts to card transactions via WhatsApp
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Frictionless receipt capture – upload receipts instantly from mobile without searching for the related transaction first.
2. Automatic matching – use OCR to extract key data and intelligently attach receipts to the correct card transaction.
3. Cleaner expense reviews – reduce manual follow-ups by ensuring receipts are correctly linked at the time of upload.
4. No lost receipts – store unmatched receipts in a dedicated holding area for later action.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Add Budget Estimation to Trip Request Flow
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Faster, higher-confidence approvals – Approvers see an estimated trip cost upfront, reducing back-and-forth questions and approval delays.
2. More complete requests from employees – Employees submit approval-ready requests with clear financial context, aligning expectations early.
3. More consistent decision-making – Budget visibility helps approvers quickly judge reasonableness and policy alignment across requests.
4. Stronger audit and spend tracking foundation – Captured budget estimates are stored for audit history and future comparison against actual spend.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Recurrent project to migrate companies from Jeeves 1.0 to Jeeves 3.0.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Recurrent project to analyse and fix bugs in production.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Implement the rules to charge platform fee from SF customers.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Real-time Fraud Verification
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Card declines due to fraud verification is a point of friction with our customers and a recurrent complaint to customer support.
2. Allow the cardholder to self-unblock when they recognize a transaction declined by fraud verification.

Unknown / Not Set.name: DeductAjustment & LoadAdjustment Rules
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. A customer should not have any pending transactions for more than 30 days.
2. By solving pending transactions, we guarantee that customers won't have pending transactions locking their CL.

Unknown / Not Set.name: World Elite in LATAM
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Premium card with enhanced benefits, mainly targeting company owners and c-level employees.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Show Users Assigned to Each Policy in Policy Manager
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Instant visibility into policy impact – Admins can immediately see how many users are governed by a policy without navigating away or cross-referencing settings.
2. Safer policy changes – Clear user assignment visibility helps admins confidently edit, deactivate, or delete policies without accidentally affecting active users.
3. Reduced admin effort – Eliminates manual checks across teams and settings, saving time especially for large orgs or temporary policies.
4. Improved auditability and governance – Real-time user lists make it easier to validate policy configuration and demonstrate control during reviews or audits.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1- Manage Policy Members Directly from Policy Screen
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Faster policy updates – Admins can add or remove users without leaving the policy screen, reducing friction and context switching.
2. Safer exception handling – Quick member changes make it easier to handle temporary travel exceptions or short-term policies without mistakes.
3. Immediate enforcement confidence – Changes take effect instantly and are reflected everywhere the policy applies, reducing uncertainty.
4. Lower admin overhead – Streamlined member management cuts down on repetitive navigation and manual coordination for policy changes.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Travel agent V1.1-Improve Copy When Deactivating or Deleting Policies with Assigned Users
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Immediate clarity on blocked actions – Admins clearly understand why a policy cannot be deactivated or deleted when users are still assigned.
2. Reduced frustration and retries – Explicit messaging eliminates confusion and prevents repeated failed attempts or support tickets.
3. Guided resolution – Clear copy tells admins exactly what to do next (remove or reassign users) to complete the action successfully.
4. More consistent policy management experience – Uniform messaging across deactivate and delete flows improves usability and trust in the system.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Failed Payment investigation agent (internal)

Unknown / Not Set.name: Payments Agent: In-Line Vendor Creation from Bulk Upload
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Customer uploads any file, any format: No need to reformat bulk payment files to adap to the Jeeves template.
2. Automatic vendor matching & creation: Reduces manual work and speeds setup – bridgin the gap between vendor management and bulk pay.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Next-Gen Invoice Forwarding (Per-Entity Inboxes)

Unknown / Not Set.name: Accounts Page design update
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
Make stablecoin usage feel first‑class, intuitive, and purpose‑built for cross‑border money movement — not a workaround on top of vendor payments.

Remove ambiguity between *accounts, wallets, payments, conversions, and withdrawals* in the stablecoin experience.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Crypto Onramp (USDC/USDT)

Unknown / Not Set.name: Manual transfers between 3P Stablecoin Accounts

Unknown / Not Set.name: “Run Your AP on Jeeves” Interactive Demo
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: A lightweight, guided AP demo accessible directly in-product, so Treasury users see Jeeves as an end-to-end AP system

Unknown / Not Set.name: Progressive AP Policy Nudges
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Progressively guide customers from Payments-only → Governed Payments → Full AP workflows, without forcing upfront complexity. This first release focuses on driving Payment Release Policy adoption for customers with no governance.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Automate Collection Fee Application
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Automatically determine the customer’s outstanding balance at the end of Day 15 of the new billing cycle, in order to consistently calculate and apply a 10% Collection Fee on that amount across CO and BR.

Unknown / Not Set.name: 28 cycles CO: Automate Jeeves Pay Interest Collection on Grace Period  (7 Days)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: This replaces the current manual Ops process and is a prerequisite to scaling to 28 billing cycles in Colombia.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Convert funds enhancement
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Elevate the Convert Funds into a first-class wallet capability with a redesigned flow that enables bi-directional amount input with real-time rate calculation.

Unknown / Not Set.name: 28 cycles CO: Pending Transactions at Statement Cutoff (High Risk Area)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Implement a billing-day cutoff time to shift late payments to the next business day, effectively minimizing pending transaction risks with low technical effort but high customer friction.

Unknown / Not Set.name: MX: Self Funded Payments powered by Direct Debit (Druo)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Allow MX customers to initiate local or cross-border payments funded directly from an external bank account, instead of using Jeeves Credit or Self-Funded balances.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Mobile Reimbursements
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Submit on the go – create, edit and track reimbursement requests from the phone with receipt upload.
2. Faster approvals – approvers act from mobile; status updates reduce back‑and‑forth.
3. Fewer mistakes – policy‑aware forms improve first‑pass success.
4. Audit‑ready – timestamps, receipts and approval trails are stored for compliance.

Unknown / Not Set.name: UI Improvement: Card Claiming & Card Activation
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Give evidence to card claiming and card activation, so users can quickly take aciton on their physical cards.

Unknown / Not Set.name: JP Flow Design Rework
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Redesign the current JP Flow, to make it an efficient bill payment flow we're all proud of

Unknown / Not Set.name: CO: Self Funded Payments powered by PSE (Partner TBC)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Enable Colombian customers to pay local vendors using their own funds collected via PSE.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Vendor documents and support in the platform
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Have the ability to attach documents to the vendor’s profile—such as tax IDs, contracts, agreements, NDAs, and other documents required by local regulations for each entity. This can help avoid losing any information and ensures it is always accessible in case of an audit or an urgent request.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Vendor Management Policy
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Strengthens security by requiring approval for new vendors and sensitive changes like bank info or tax IDs.
2. Reduces fraud and data-quality issues through structured oversight tied to vendor owners and admins.
3. Improves visibility and control with a dedicated “Pending Vendor Approvals” section and full audit trails.

Unknown / Not Set.name: VCN: Card Spend Limit in Foreign Currency
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. VCN customers will be able to define the card spend limit in foreign currency, ideally matching the reservation amount.
2. For international bookings, customers will be able to match the merchant currency with the card spend limit.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Apple Pay & Google Pay
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Instant "In-Person" Power for Virtual Cards: by integrating with digital wallets, customers can instantly issue a virtual card  and use it in brick-and-mortar stores.
2. Enhanced Security via Tokenization & Biometrics: Apple and Google Pay replace sensitive card numbers with an unique encrypted token for every transaction.
3. Frictionless Travel & Expense Experience: Digital wallets allow for contactless payment without fumbling for a wallet or entering PINs.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Revisit logic for capturing approved vs not-required payment statuses
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Improved data integrity – approvals now accurately reflect whether a payment passed through a JP policy.
2. Clearer reporting – analytics and dashboards can reliably separate policy-driven approvals from bypassed cases.
3. Better compliance tracking – finance teams gain visibility into true policy enforcement rates.
4. Reliable automation – downstream triggers (e.g., reconciliations, alerts) now execute only on genuinely approved payments.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Pricing Plan: Fees for Card ATM Withdrawals
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Give transparency to customers on how much they're being charged for ATM transactions.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Recurrent project to migrate companies from Jeeves 1.0 to Jeeves 3.0.

Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Recurrent project to analyse and fix bugs in production.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Cards API: Onboarding (M3)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Recurrent project to onboard new customers to Jeeves Cards API.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Card Replacement with ABU File
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Allow the user to replace a card without having to cancel and request a new card.
2. Create a seamless experience for virtual and physical cards, including World Elite.
3. When a card is replaced, update all card on file merchants with the new card number - ABU file.

Unknown / Not Set.name: New Finance Team Member role
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Grant precise access without over-permissioning Give finance and ops teammates access to AP, reimbursements, and spend visibility without full admin rights.
2. Scale finance workflows as teams grow Support mid-tier roles like AP and reimbursement managers without routing all work through a single admin.
3. Reduce risk while maintaining control Keep admin-only settings locked down while enabling day-to-day finance operations.
4. Simplify onboarding and role management Assign the right access at invite or edit, with clear role labels and configurable permissions.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Employee role — default optional permissions OFF (and reset when switching to Employee)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Grant precise access without over-permissioning Give finance and ops teammates access to AP, reimbursements, and spend visibility without full admin rights.
2. Scale finance workflows as teams grow Support mid-tier roles like AP and reimbursement managers without routing all work through a single admin.
3. Reduce risk while maintaining control Keep admin-only settings locked down while enabling day-to-day finance operations.
4. Simplify onboarding and role management Assign the right access at invite or edit, with clear role labels and configurable permissions.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Bookkeeper role consistency
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Treat bookkeepers as first-class finance users Align the Bookkeeper role with other core roles, matching customer expectations for internal finance teams.
2. Enable flexible role changes over time Allow bookkeepers to be reassigned to other roles as responsibilities evolve.
3. Remove unexpected card restrictions Ensure card eligibility follows permission logic, not hard role-type blocks.
4. Reduce confusion in role management Present Bookkeeper as a standard role in role selection, improving clarity and admin confidence.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Bulk card control editing
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Time savings – update dozens or hundreds of cards in seconds instead of one-by-one.
2. Error reduction – bulk confirmation and audit logging prevent inconsistent manual edits.
3. Stronger control – enforce company-wide or department-level spend policies instantly.
4. Operational flexibility – temporary or recurring changes (e.g., during events or campaigns) can be applied in bulk without IT involvement.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Card Upgrade with ABU File
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Allow the customer to upgrade the card from regular physical card to World Elite without having to cancel the card.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Surface AI Receipt Match Evaluation in Transaction Modal
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
Instant Confidence in Receipt Accuracy
Customers can immediately see whether a receipt matches the transaction, reducing guesswork and manual verification.

Faster Close and Easier Audits
Early detection of mismatched receipts minimizes back-and-forth during month-end close and audit reviews.

Stronger Compliance Without Added Friction
AI-driven validation improves control and accuracy without blocking cardholders or adding extra workflow steps.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Multi Org Experience (Phase 0)
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Single-session finance workflows – access statements and transactions across all orgs without repeated logins or context switching.
2. Faster month-end close – export statements and transactions per org or across orgs in one flow while preserving entity-level identifiers.
3. Reduced operational repetition – eliminate org-by-org manual work for high-frequency accounting tasks.
4. Lower risk of accounting errors – maintain clear org context across views and exports to prevent cross-entity mistakes.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Employee Card Transaction Categorization
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Cleaner spend attribution at source – enable employees to categorize transactions by department, location, and custom fields at the time of purchase.
2. Reduced accounting rework – minimize manual corrections by allowing bookkeepers and admins to review and override categorizations only when needed.
3. Stronger policy compliance – enforce mandatory categorization through policies to ensure every transaction is properly tagged.
4. Improved adoption for multi-location orgs – support real-world operational structures (departments, locations) to make Jeeves viable for complex spend management use cases.

Unknown / Not Set.name: SAP S4Hana Integration
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Introduce an SAP Accounting integration, unlocking large players in the market that require an integration to confidently use the Jeeves platform.

Unknown / Not Set.name: NetSuite Partnership
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Become an official NetSuite partner app in LatAm, allowing for NetSuite customers to discover us through the NetSuite platform as an official cards + payment solution.

Unknown / Not Set.name: CMS Tighter Controls
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Mitigate Audit & Financial risk by implementing "Maker/Checker" approvals for Credit Limit changes.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Pluggy Integration
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: Customers don't have to provide bank statements and more customers can now be eligible for larger proactive CLIs with this data

Unknown / Not Set.name: Enable CREAM experience for all customers (USD Credit)
Enforce invoice Policies
Unknown / Not Set.pillar:
1. Stronger spend controls: Bills above the threshold cannot be sent without an invoice, reducing policy violations.
2. Reduced risk of errors or non-compliance: Mandatory enforcement ensures all required documentation is attached before approval.
3. Clear guidance for users: Red banners and error states provide immediate feedback, minimizing confusion.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Multi-Org Phase 1: Cross-Org Statements & Transactions
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Faster month-end close: Finance teams can access statements and transactions across all orgs without logging in and out of each entity.                                                                      2. Reduced operational overhead: Export transactions across orgs with clear entity identifiers, eliminating repeated manual workflows.                                                                     3. Lower accounting risk: Clear org/entity context in UI and exports reduces reconciliation errors for multi-entity companies.

Unknown / Not Set.name: Multi-Org Phase 2: Finance Visibility & Treasury
Unknown / Not Set.pillar: 1. Executive visibility: CFOs and finance leaders can see balances, credit exposure, and spend across entities in one place.                                             2. Treasury efficiency: Faster decision-making with clear cross-org liquidity visibility and safe drill-downs to org-level actions.                                                                                     3. Stronger governance: Clear separation between visibility and execution preserves auditability while improving control.”

yes.name: POC - U/W data pipelines in Colombia  (DIAN integration, provider Konvex?)
yes.pillar: DIAN, Colombia's tax authority, for retrival of Colombian businesses tax and revenue data for a potentially higher credit limit

yes.name: POC - U/W integration in Brazil for Duplicates / Card Receivables - (CERC integration)
yes.pillar: Ability to increase credit limit by securitizing the customers' dupulicatas / card receivables

yes.name: Fraud and security:  move 3DS to the app from SMS
yes.pillar:
1. Stronger protection – in-app 3DS removes exposure to SIM-swap and SMS interception attacks.
2. Faster checkout – users approve transactions instantly within the app, without waiting for a code.
3. Higher completion rates – fewer timeouts or failed authentications improve transaction success.
4. Consistent global UX – one unified, app-based flow across all regions and devices.

yes.name: “Can create and manage card spend limits” permission
yes.pillar:
1. Granular access control – delegate card issuance and limit management without granting full admin or treasury access.
2. Improved security – supports least-privilege principles, reducing the risk of unauthorized access or configuration changes.
3. Simpler delegation – permissions can be granted per user directly from the Teams → Members page.
4. Future-ready framework – establishes a unified permission model that integrates seamlessly with other upcoming access-based features (e.g., Policies & Approvals).

yes.name: Fraud and security:  new MFA implementation with code rendered on screen (like github and google)
yes.pillar:
1. Stronger account protection – on-screen MFA codes greatly reduce risks of phishing or message interception.
2. Modernized experience – familiar, secure verification flow consistent with trusted platforms like GitHub and Google.
3. Faster authentication – eliminates delays caused by email or SMS delivery failures.
4. Higher reliability – ensures users can always complete MFA, even if communication channels are unavailable.

yes.name: Post card transactions approvals
yes.pillar:
1. Stronger spend control without slowing teams – review and approve expenses after the transaction using configurable, multi-layer approval flows.
2. Review by exception – automatically route only out-of-policy, high-value, or anomalous transactions for approval to reduce manager workload.
3. Faster, clearer resolution – give managers and admins all context (receipt, notes, flags) in one place to approve or reject expenses quickly.
4. Enterprise-grade compliance at scale – enforce consistent approval rules across teams, regions, and currencies while maintaining a simple employee experience.

yes.name: R3 _ Spend management basics - User Limits (Employee Budget)
yes.pillar:
1. Unified spend control – manage all of an employee’s card spend through a single, consolidated budget.
2. Greater flexibility – set one-time or recurring budgets that automatically reset per period.
3. Transparency & accountability – real-time notifications show when a decline is due to budget or card limit.
4. Simplified management – adjust budgets directly from the Teams page without changing card limits.

yes.name: Vendor Management Policy (Claudio will drive policy definition and Money team will introduce the concept of vendor in status pending)
yes.pillar:
1. Stronger vendor governance – critical vendor creations and edits require explicit approval, minimizing fraud and compliance risks.
2. Smarter routing – approvals are automatically directed to the vendor owner’s manager or default admin, ensuring accountability without slowing operations.
3. End-to-end visibility – pending changes, approvals, and audit trails are all visible in one place for easy tracking and review.
4. Transparent notifications – vendor owners and approvers receive automatic alerts for edits, approvals, and pending items, keeping all stakeholders informed.

yes.name: Niva Onboarding Automation
yes.pillar: This integration will allow up to fill in the majority of a users application for them, without error, allowing for a much faster and accurate onboarding experience.
